result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared A. Beaulieu was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Intimidation of a Victim, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**0 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jared A. Beaulieu

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.

(2:29 PM cases 21CM822, 22CF75 called.) Judge Beverly Wickstrom for Branch 3.
All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.  
Defendant Jared A. Beaulieu appeared by video, in custody in the Green Bay Correctional Institution. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Jared A. Beaulieu. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CM822 Count 1: Domestic Misdemeanor Battery and 22CF75 Count 1: Felony Intimidation of a Victim.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CM822 Count 1 and 22CF75 Count 1.
Parties request the Court follow the joint sentencing recommendation.

22CF75:
Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 18 months on 22CF75 Count 1 with the following conditions:
30 days jail, stayed pending further order of the Court. No contact with victim R.R. or R.R.'s residence. No contact with A.S. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Complete a Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 0 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 

21CM822:
Court orders the defendant to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs in 21CM822. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

10:06 AM Cases 21CM822 & 22CF75. Defendant Jared A. Beaulieu not in court, it was believed Defendant was at Racine Youthful Offender Correctional Facility. The facility indicated Defendant is no longer there.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Jared A. Beaulieu. Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ARGN: 09/01/22 at 2:30pm

9:34 AM cases 22CF75, 21CM822 called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jared A. Beaulieu appeared by video from Racine Correctional.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Jared A. Beaulieu. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 

Branch 3 for scheduling Arraignment.

10:24 AM cases 21CM822, 22CF75 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jared A. Beaulieu not in court.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Jared A. Beaulieu. Defendant in custody, facility unable to connect.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
